newsitem.title: FRANCE: Committee to hear Aerospatiale, Thomson heads.
newsitem.headline: Committee to hear Aerospatiale, Thomson heads.

text.p: The chairmen of the Aerospatiale group and defence electronics firm Thomson-CSF will give evidence to the National Assembly defence committee next Wednesday, parliamentary sources said on Friday.
Aerospatiale's Yves Michot will speak at 0700 GMT, and Thomson-CSF's Marcel Roulet will follow at 0800 GMT.
The committee will also hear in the afternoon Pierre Joxe, a president of the audit office.
The committee, headed by Socialist Paul Quiles, last week heard evidence from defence minister Alain Richard.

The audit office last week published a report which criticised overspending on major defence programmes including the Rafale combat jet from Dassault Aviation and the Charles de Gaulle nuclear-powered aircraft carrier.
The previous conservative government had planned to sell the state's 58 percent stake in Thomson-CSF this year and merge Aerospatiale and Dassault and privatise the new group.
